intro: Bafutia tenuicaulis, commonly known as the slender-stemmed bafutia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, upright stems and small, showy flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
